@eheads: No crack is needed.  

Use serial included, 
or this one CXDBL-FMDBX-URGAJ-XREA7-XXD4W

Make sure the  internet connection is OFF when putting in the serial number.  

OR block the programs access to the internet using a firewall!

If you don't, the game will say the serial is invalid.
How do I unpack this baby? Usually there is a rar file. 7-zip can't seem to do the job, havn't seen that before! Thanks for all answers.

The ViTALiTY release is buggy. Google this: Tropico.3.v1.04.Update-SKIDROW.rar

This fix re-activates the serial (add the tropico3.exe to your firewall) and fixes various bugs.

Runs smooth on a amd4600 gt250 xp pro sp3.

Powerarchiver will recognize the file extension. Any other advanced tool will unrar too, you just need to open the *.001

I downloaded the other vitality yesterday (the one with most seeders) and the files couldnt be mounted, there was no iso or exe or anything, im gonna assume this is kinda the same but i couldnt get any help from the comments in the other because they are bugged, can someone help me and tell me how to use all those files you get in this?
Works great :D
To cgijoe123: The iso is packed into separate archives. All you gotta do is select the first file to unpack, and your unzipper should do the rest.

For anyone who just sees a bunch of unrecognised files after download and hasn't a clue what to do, you just need to use a different archiving tool. There's a good 30 day trial one at http://www.powerarchiver.com/download/ (or you can probably get the full version free here somewhere). Point it to where you've downloaded the file and then mount the extracted file with http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/downloads or whatever tool you choose.
The serial does not work!

I'm having a bit of a problem, I successfully downloaded, installed, put in serial, got to the main menu. then when i go to play a game I select my island, then it goes to the loading screen and during the loading screen it closes and says it encountered a problem. Any help? I reinstalled numerous times and still no luck.

Sorry vladimir002. Not sure what would make that happen. Occasionally happens if the graphics card is not supported even though it should be picked up during install. Could try update your graphics driver if you haven't already. Make sure you block Tropico from connecting to the internet although I doubt that's what's causing the problem. I'm assuming the error message came from windows and not the game. If there was an error code post that, it may help.
